Title: Node.js 16 runtime
Description: Lambda now supports a new runtime for Node.js 16. Node.js 16 uses Amazon Linux 2. For details, see Building Lambda functions with Node.js.
Parsed Description: a new runtime for Node.js 16. Node.js 16 uses Amazon Linux 2

Title: Lambda function URLs
Description: Lambda now supports function URLs, which are dedicated HTTP(S) endpoints for Lambda functions. For details, see Lambda function URLs.
Parsed Description: function URLs, which are dedicated HTTP(S) endpoints for Lambda functions

Title: Shared test events in the AWS Lambda console
Description: Lambda now supports sharing test events with other IAM users in the same AWS account. For details, see Testing Lambda functions in the console.
Parsed Description: sharing test events with other IAM users in the same AWS account

Title: PrincipalOrgId in resource-based policies
Description: Lambda now supports granting permissions to an organization in AWS Organizations. For details, see Using resource-based policies for AWS Lambda.
Parsed Description: granting permissions to an organization in AWS Organizations

Title: .NET 6 runtime
Description: Lambda now supports a new runtime for .NET 6. For details, see Lambda runtimes.

Title: Event filtering for Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Amazon SQS event sources
Description: Lambda now supports event filtering for Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Amazon SQS event sources. For details, see Lambda event filtering.
Parsed Description: event filtering for Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Amazon SQS event sources

Title: mTLS authentication for Amazon MSK and self-managed Apache Kafka event sources
Description: Lambda now supports mTLS authentication for Amazon MSK and self-managed Apache Kafka event sources. For details, see Using Lambda with Amazon MSK.
Parsed Description: mTLS authentication for Amazon MSK and self-managed Apache Kafka event sources

Title: Lambda on Graviton2
Description: Lambda now supports Graviton2 for functions using arm64 architecture. For details, see Lambda instruction set architectures.
Parsed Description: Graviton2 for functions using arm64 architecture

Title: Python 3.9 runtime
Description: Lambda now supports a new runtime for Python 3.9. For details, see Lambda runtimes.

Title: Support for RabbitMQ as an event source on Lambda
Description: Lambda now supports Amazon MQ for RabbitMQ as an event source. Amazon MQ is a managed message broker service for Apache ActiveMQ and RabbitMQ that makes it easy to set up and operate message brokers in the cloud. For details, see Using Lambda with Amazon MQ.
Parsed Description: Amazon MQ for RabbitMQ as an event source

Title: Node.js 14 runtime
Description: Lambda now supports a new runtime for Node.js 14. Node.js 14 uses Amazon Linux 2. For details, see Building Lambda functions with Node.js.
Parsed Description: a new runtime for Node.js 14. Node.js 14 uses Amazon Linux 2
